posts.post_content:
Beautiful 1 or 2 drop enemy-board-wipe or enemy-weaken spell. Choose to take out one at gutshot price or get an earthquake-type effect for 2 that doesn't hurt you at all. All at instant speed. Great for drafts too.
  
   
5/5 for art, utility and cost effectiveness. And its a common. (O\_o)

5/5 for art, utility and cost effectiveness. And its a common. (O_o)

posts.post_content: This will see play in every single Red mage's sideboard in Pauper as a replacement for [Seismic Shudder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seismic Shudder), of which is now obsoleted. Generally, you'll only be using it against Storm decks anyhow, but you can't say no to a little versatility and a new way of dealing with turn-1 mana elves, delvers, etc. while still being able to have a one-sided boardwipe if necessary.

Posted By: Trygon_Predator (9/26/2012 1:19:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ehh. As a single target spell, it's not worth bringing up at all. As a overloaded spell, it's a faster but weaker [Pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyroclasm). Yes it wipes tokens, but so does [Izzet Staticaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Izzet Staticaster), which has mana-free activation on legs. I'm failing to see the potential in this.  
  
Edit: Oh yeah, it can get around hexproof. [Goblin Electromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Electromancer) also makes the overload cost the same as the ordinary spell, which is actually pretty wonderful. I'd still usually take the Staticaster, but this is fine in an instant-centric deck.
posts.html:
Ehh. As a single target spell, it's not worth bringing up at all. As a overloaded spell, it's a faster but weaker Pyroclasm. Yes it wipes tokens, but so does Izzet Staticaster, which has mana-free activation on legs. I'm failing to see the potential in this.

Edit: Oh yeah, it can get around hexproof. Goblin Electromancer also makes the overload cost the same as the ordinary spell, which is actually pretty wonderful. I'd still usually take the Staticaster, but this is fine in an instant-centric deck.
